# SetEnableWithCompletion

**Instance Method**

Enables or disables the delivery of interrupts.

## Declaration

```swift
kern_return_t SetEnableWithCompletion(bool enable, IODispatchSourceCancelHandlerhandler);
```

## Parameters

- **enable**: A Boolean value that indicates whether to enable the dispatch source. Specify `true` to enable the dispatch source, or `false` to disable it.
- **handler**: An optional block to execute when disabling the dispatch source. The dispatch source executes it after all pending interrupts finish executing.

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.driverkit/documentation/DriverKit/kIOReturnSuccess] on success, or another value if an error occurs. See [doc://com.apple.driverkit/documentation/DriverKit/error-codes].

## Starting and Stopping the Interrupt Source

- **Cancel**: Cancels all callbacks from the event source.
- **IODispatchSourceCancelHandler**: A block to execute when a canceled dispatch source stops executing tasks.
